page.title: 04TEDBURN SCHOOL HISTORY 1/2
page.content:
"Dames" schools existed in Tedburn from the early 1800's. In 1840 there were 9 operating in the village. In 1873 a notice was pinned to the church door which said that the education department required "Public School Accommodation" in the district for 120 children.
Tedurn School was opened on the 19th March 1877 for children aged 7 to 14 years old, and about 70 childen attended in its first year. It appears that boys and girls were taught in separate classes.
Each year HMI inspectors tested the standards of reading, writing and arithmetic. There was also a scripture examination.
